content.raw:
The 2nd model is inserted into the world, with a 4m offset in pose as well as changing the gazebo in and out ports. And I modified parameter file to add `SYSID_THISMAV 2`.

For the first drone I ran sim_vehicles.py 
And for the 2nd drone I modified the command line arguments manually for mavproxy and ardupilot with the port numbers adjusted etc. Like this: https://gist.github.com/tfoote/81b2b1b4035f999fed6229ca76b10a31 since sim_vehicle does not have enough options for this at the moment. 

I also noticed that port 5501 seems to be unused but declared here: `--sitl 127.0.0.1:5501`. I found no traffic on that port, maybe it's used for different sitl versions?

I got them to takeoff by using QGroundControl. Then I uploaded the default flight plan to both. On each one I "armed" and then set mode auto. It falls back to RTL due to no companion computer, but once it was in RTL I sent it auto again and then they flew.
content.html:
The 2nd model is inserted into the world, with a 4m offset in pose as well as changing the gazebo in and out ports. And I modified parameter file to add SYSID_THISMAV 2.

For the first drone I ran sim_vehicles.py And for the 2nd drone I modified the command line arguments manually for mavproxy and ardupilot with the port numbers adjusted etc. Like this: https://gist.github.com/tfoote/81b2b1b4035f999fed6229ca76b10a31 since sim_vehicle does not have enough options for this at the moment.

I also noticed that port 5501 seems to be unused but declared here: --sitl 127.0.0.1:5501. I found no traffic on that port, maybe it's used for different sitl versions?

I got them to takeoff by using QGroundControl. Then I uploaded the default flight plan to both. On each one I "armed" and then set mode auto. It falls back to RTL due to no companion computer, but once it was in RTL I sent it auto again and then they flew.
